intro: Elleanthus orozcoae, commonly known as the Mexican dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, with yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open fields. Elleanthus orozcoae is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
